snippet: The old verities of African-American modern dance have not been abandoned by Cleo Parker Robinson and her namesake troupe.
abstract: Brian Seibert reviews performance by the Cleo Parker Robinson Dance Ensemble, including the world premiere of a work by Jeanguy Saintus, at the Damrosch Park Bandshell as part of the Lincoln Center Out of Doors festival.
lead_paragraph: The old verities of African-American modern dance have not been abandoned by Cleo Parker Robinson and her namesake troupe.

headline.seo: Cleo Parker Robinson Dance Ensemble at Lincoln Center
headline.main: A Colorado Troupe Brings Jazz, Mambo, Swing and Haitian Spice
headline.print_headline: A Colorado Troupe Brings Jazz, Mambo, Swing and Haitian Spice
headline.kicker: Dance Review | Cleo Parker Robinson Dance Ensemble
